The two last cases depend on the principle of successio. The grandchild is at birth in the power of bis grandfather, but is not his suus heres, so long as there is an intervening ascendant— the father—in the same power. On the death of the intervening ascendant the grandchild is said to succeed to his place, and be- comes by such succession suus heres to his grandfather. Van· gerow‚ ξ 468.
